subject: Sales
title: BANT: Budget Authority Need Timeline
description: One-minute skill: BANT: Budget Authority Need Timeline.

hook.text: IBM created BANT decades ago. It's been declared dead many times, yet reps still use it every day.

buildup.text: BANT qualifies prospects on four dimensions: Budget, Authority, Need, and Timeline.

discovery.text: A prospect missing any BANT element is a risk. The framework forces honest deal viability assessment.

twist.text: Critics say buyers often don't know their budget upfront. Need frequently precedes budget approval.

climax.text: Use BANT as a starting filter, not a rigid gate. Combine it with deeper discovery for best results.

punchline.text: BANT isn't dead. It just needs modern context.

quiz.question: What does the 'A' in BANT stand for?
